titles.title: 10-20-Life Act

To amend title 18, United States Code, to increase the penalties for possessing or using a firearm in the commission of a felony crime of violence or drug trafficking crime, and to require juveniles age 14 or older who so possess or use a firearm to be tried as adults.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 2/8/2000--Introduced. 10-20-Life Act - Amends the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act to increase penalties for using, carrying, or possessing a firearm during and in relation to a crime of violence or drug trafficking crime. Sets penalties of life imprisonment or a term of at least 25 years imprisonment if an individual is injured by the discharge of a firearm.Defines "juvenile delinquency" to exclude such violation committed by a person age14 or older (thus providing for their trial as adults).
